laboratory_examinations.findings: There is a 2.0 x 1.8 x 1.5 cm area of hypodensity in the lateral left lobe of the liver; an additional 0.8 cm hypodensity is noted in the left lobe. The gallbladder is mildly distended and the common bile duct measures 0.6 - 0.7 cm. Significant findings include extensive sigmoid and descending colon diverticulosis with focal wall thickening, inflammatory changes, and a possible small focus of extraluminal gas.
8.6 mg/dL (reference range: 8.4 - 10.3 mg/dL) - within normal range.
